result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon P. Schlachter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jonathon P. Schlachter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jonathon P. Schlachter was found guilty of Reckless Driving-Endanger Safety. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Sealed by court

Defendant Jonathon P. Schlachter in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called 8:59pm - State's witness will not be testifying today.  Witness will not be coming due to weather conditions - State will not be able to proceed without witness - Resolution has been reached - 9:04am jury present - Court advises jury of cancellation reason - Statements by Bayne-Allison - Statements by Koppelman - 9:10am Jurors discharged by court - 9:22am on record - Resolution has been reached - Motion to amend to non-creiminal offense 346.62(2) Reckless driving - $200.00 forf plus costs - Count 2 dismissed with prejudice - Arguments by Bayne-Allison/Koppelman/Court - Defendant has complied with drivers safety plan - Plea no contest to amended charge - Found guilty - $481.50 imposed due within 60 days

Defendant Jonathon P. Schlachter in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 1:33pm on record - (4) sidebars put on record plus conference in Rotunda and Chambers - Statements by Bayne-Allison/Koppelman - 1:47pm Jury present - 1:48pm Opening statements - 1:48pm Opening statements by DA Bayne-Allison - 1:53pm Opening statements by Attorney Koppelman - Deputy Gehris called - Sworn - 2:01pm  Direct by Bayne-Allison - Defendant identified by witness - Exhibit #4 marked Blood/Urine Analysis form - Exhibit #5 marked (DVD of stop) - Stipulation to admission of exhibit - 2:42pm DVD played for jury - 3:22pm Video complete -3:22pm Side bar - Continued direct - 3:25pm recess -3:37pm Jury absent on record - 3:39pm Jury present - Deputy Gehris resumes stand - Cross by Koppelman - Exhibit #6 marked, Deputy Gehris' report - Exhibit #7 marked (Attorney Koppelman's disk of stop) heard by Deputy only - 4:22pm Redirect by Bayne-Allison - 4:26pm Follow up by Koppelman - 4:27pm Connie Duerkop called - Sworn - Direct by DA Bayne-Allison - Cross by Koppelman - 4:36pm Jury excused - 4:38pm Jury absent - exhibit #6 offered and received - Will go back on record at 9:00am Recess -

Called @ 9:33 am. Appearances the same as before. Brief recess. Recalled. Appearances the same. Brief recess. Recalled. Appearances the same. Completed @ 12:15 pm. Instructions given. Lunch recess until 1:30 for the jurors.

Regarding Pretrial Motions

Defendant Jonathon P. Schlachter in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. FTR being used - Court addresses counsel as to this trial being finished in 1 day - State wants to bring in all 6 of defendant's prior convictions - Arguments by Dunphy/Koppelman - States believes OWI 1st and Operate without a license will not come in as they are not crimes - 2001, 2002 criminal convictions will be excluded - Must answer yes to priors and how many times - 3 times - 07CF109, 06CT190 (Oneida) - 2012CM OWI 3rd (Marathon County) - Court reviews State's motion and copies made for counsel - Arguments by Dunphy to State's motion - Response by Koppelman - Court believes a letter brief will be required - Court will view video - Continued motion hearing will be needed - Trial will be removed - Probable cause decision has already been made, will not rehash at trial - Koppelman will not be arguing that the arrest was not legal - Defense does not believe the court needs to view the CD on the record but could do it outside the courtroom - State believes the court could view CD in chambers -  The jury trial will be taken off the calendar for 10/4/16 and we will have a continued motion hearing -
Motion hearing on October 3, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jonathon P. Schlachter in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16TR51 tracking - Witness Deputy James Gehris duly sworn. Direct by Dunphy.  Cross by Koppelman. Exhibit #1 marked DVD - Exhibit #2 marked,  probable cause portion of warrant - 1:34 video stopped by counsel - Exhibit #3 marked, narrative report - Exhibit's #1-#3 offered and received by court - Redirect by Dunphy - Arguments by Dunphy/Koppelman to motion - Court finds there was sufficient evidence to request a PBT - Court does not finds gaps in tape to be revelant - Discussion with training officer is only discussion that is not recorded - Discussion with defendant was recorded - Not an altering evidence case - Court finds probable cause for arrest -  Court denies motion to suppress - Bond continued and conditions of bond  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 10:00 am.
